snippet: Representative Paul D. Ryan, the defeated 2012 vice-presidential nominee, drafted a debt ceiling proposal that fellow Republicans embraced, though it doesn’t mention President Obama’s health care law.
abstract: Rep Paul D Ryan, defeated 2012 vice-presidential nominee, remains powerful presence among House Republicans, earning respect of hard-line conservatives for his budget blueprint and trust of anxious moderates for his pragmatism; he has suddenly emerged, amidst the government impasse, as essential to rescue of GOP.
lead_paragraph: Representative Paul D. Ryan, the defeated 2012 vice-presidential nominee, drafted a debt ceiling proposal that fellow Republicans embraced, though it doesn’t mention President Obama’s health care law.

headline.main: Ryan Is Again in the Forefront for the G.O.P.
headline.print_headline: Ryan Is Again In the Forefront For the G.O.P.
